intro: Senecio charaguensis, commonly known as the charaguensis groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its leaves are often lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Senecio charaguensis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is part of the diverse flora of the Andean region.
